text: The major disaster declaration for Virginia for Hurricane Helene was amended on Oct. 25, approving Individual Assistance for eligible residents of Lee County and Public Assistance under Categories A-G for several counties. For more info visit: https://www.fema.gov/press-release/20241026/fema-assistance-now-available-additional-virginia-counties

Homeowners & renters in eligible counties can apply for FEMA Assistance due to damages from Hurricanes #Debby, #Helene & #Milton.  Ways to apply: 🖥️ DisasterAssistance.gov 📱 Download the FEMA App ☎️ Call 1-800-621-3362  For more recovery info - FloridaDisaster.org/Updates.

If you were affected by #Helene or #Milton, we have Disaster Recovery Centers open across all affected states to offer in-person support with your disaster assistance application.  Visit us if you have questions about your application or need to speak with a FEMA representative.

Flooding continues to impact many Florida communities, bringing difficult challenges.  If your home was affected, take precautions before re-entering, and remember we are here to support your recovery.  Safety tips and next steps ⤵️

More areas have been added to the list of eligible localities for disaster assistance.  If you need help, please visit a Disaster Recovery Center in your area.  Find more information at fema.gov/disaster/4831.

#USACE New England District Commander, Col. Justin Pabis and a team of engineers are inspecting damaged bridges in western North Carolina following Hurricane #Helene. Their goal: assess infrastructure to ensure EMS access for affected communities.

Hace un mes, #Helene tocó tierra. Toda la comunidad — incluyendo gobiernos en todos los niveles, las organizaciones sin fines de lucro, las empresas privadas, los grupos comunitarios y los vecinos — tomaron acción para ayudar a necesitados.  Más: youtube.com/watch?app=deskto…

Attention #Florida: Impacted by Hurricane #Milton? Operation Blue Roof offers free temporary roof repairs!  Sign up at blueroof.gov or call 888-ROOF-BLU (888-766-3258). The sign-up period ends Nov. 5.  Get help today! #BlueRoof #RoofRepairs

Do not wait for FEMA Individual Assistance to become available before removing flood debris from your home. Residents are encouraged to photograph damage before mucking and gutting begins and should save receipts for any costs related to the flooding.
In the midst of crisis recovery, it can be easy to feel overwhelmed.  We're here to help.  Call or text the Disaster Distress Helpline 1-800-985-5990 for help.

Debris collection is ongoing around the clock! For an efficient collection process, please keep your piles separated with 3 ft clearance on the sides.   Learn more & see a progress map for the FIRST pass of debris pickup: tampa.gov/debris There will be multiple passes.

One month ago, Hurricane #Helene made landfall. The whole community—including government at all levels, nonprofits, private companies, community groups, and neighbors—sprang into action to assist those in need. We are stronger together.

1 month after #Helene, our federal family is working to help survivors & their communities recover.  Our response in #NorthCarolina by the numbers: 🔹 Nearly $350 million for recovery 🔹 19 Disaster Recovery Centers & over 400 staff providing in-person support for survivors

.@FEMA is hiring in #NorthCarolina! We're looking for passionate people with a wide range of skillsets who want to help their communities heal and rebuild after #Helene.  Learn more & apply here 👉 usajobs.gov/Search/Results?l…

Homeowners & Renters: if you suffered damages from both #Helene & #Milton & are eligible for disaster assistance, you need to submit 2 different applications - one for each storm.  Apply via: disasterassistance.gov, call 800-621-3362, FEMA App, or visit a local DRC.  More info⤵️

#Helene and #Milton survivors: if you suffered flooding damages & have insurance, jump-start your recovery by contacting your agent ASAP to start the claim process.  Call or visit floodsmart.gov/flood-insuran… if you need help locating your insurance carrier.

#Helene #ByTheNumbers: One Month Later ⤵️  - Over $1.4B for recovery in affected communities - Nearly 5,000 personnel helping on the ground  Our federal family is working to meet the needs of survivors & affected communities. We will be there for as long as it takes to recover.

Hillsborough County and the Florida Department of Emergency Management (FDEM) will close the Multi-Agency Resource Center (MARC) in Town ‘N Country for individuals impacted by Hurricanes Milton, Helene, and Debby at 5:30 p.m. Sunday, Oct. 27.   Details: https://bit.ly/48pup2x

"We're working on putting the river back where it was so we can have a place to rebuild the road."  Old Toe River Road in Avery County is a complete rebuild after #HeleneNC, but a vital one to getting WNC back to full strength.

Jeffry Fritsma, #USACE Detroit District and Bobbi Trout, Omaha District, discuss collection of information for the Operation Blue Roof mission. Temporary roofs protect property and allow residents to remain in their homes while recovering from Hurricane #Milton. 1/2
